intro: Cynoctonum boerhavifolium, commonly known as the Boerhavia-leaved cynoctonum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cynoglossaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive, heart-shaped base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
